intro: Hypolytrum jenmanii subsp. jenmanii, commonly known as the Jenman's hypolytrum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a perennial herb with slender, upright stems that produce small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as swampy areas or along streambanks. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color, and it is known for its delicate, grass-like appearance. The species is part of the Restionaceae family, which includes many plants adapted to moist, temperate climates.
